thread.title: Ground News - Nikki Haley campaign event in South Carolina interrupted by pro-Palestine protesters
thread.title_full: Ground News - Nikki Haley campaign event in South Carolina interrupted by pro-Palestine protesters

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Nikki Haley campaign event in South Carolina interrupted by pro-Palestine protesters
text: 6 Articles 6 Articles [The Independent 8 hours ago·London, United KingdomRead Full Article] Nikki Haley's campaign event in Columbia, South Carolina, was interrupted by pro-Palestine protesters on Thursday, 1 February. The Republican presidential candidate was speaking in her home state during a meet-and-greet at Doc's BBQ on Shop Road when a protester began shouting "Free free Palestine." At least two protesters were escorted out of the room. In response, Ms Haley said: "Don't ever get upset about people like that because my husband a… [The Hill 9 hours ago·Washington, United StatesRead Full Article] Haley campaign event disrupted by ‘Free Palestine’ protesters “Free Palestine” protesters disrupted a campaign event for GOP presidential candidate Nikki Haley in South Carolina Thursday, calling for an immediate cease-fire in Gaza. A small group of protesters interrupted the former governor’s campaign event in Columbia, S.C. with chants of “Free, Free Palestine,” before some of them were escorted out of the event. Haley… [The Epoch Times 6 hours ago·New York, United StatesRead Full Article] Nikki Haley Rally Interrupted by Pro-Palestinian Protesters Presidential candidate Nikki Haley’s Thursday campaign rally in Columbia, South Carolina, was interrupted by chants from pro-Palestinian protesters. After they were cleared out, the state’s former governor responded with a smile, “Don’t ever get upset about people like that because my husband and military men and women sacrifice every day for their right to do that.” ... [NTD News 6 hours agoRead Full Article] Nikki Haley Rally Interrupted by Pro-Palestinian Protesters Presidential candidate Nikki Haley’s Thursday campaign rally in Columbia, South Carolina, was interrupted by chants from pro-Palestinian protesters.
